issue.title: Blocking all 88x31 buttons
issue.body:
***Description***: AdguardFilters blocks 88x31 size images, but many of the times, they are not ads at all. For example, they are used to [indicate a Creative Commons license](https://creativecommons.org/about/downloads/) or to [display the site owner's favorite tools, memes, beliefs, and interests](https://cyber.dabamos.de/88x31/index.html). * **Current behaviour**: All images/buttons that specify size 88x31 in the HTML are hidden by the filter `##img[width="88"][height="31"]` in [AdGuard Tracking Protection](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/general_elemhide.txt).
Screenshot: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51103593/140278755-eeedd612-5776-4a26-84f9-4652d5ed2702.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51103593/140278792-d4cf3634-b7af-4754-b4ba-8b7594358f8e.png)

* **Expected behaviour**: 88x31 images should not blocked by AdGuard
Screenshot: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51103593/140278560-025871da-6498-455f-9ca6-b90ea21ed702.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51103593/140278833-c8d1fc2e-6eff-41b6-b34a-08de1d721030.png)

***Steps to reproduce the problem***: 1. Visit any page with 88x31 buttons (e.g. ) 2. Buttons are hidden :sob: ***System configuration*** **Filters:** AdGuard Tracking Protection Information | Value --- | --- Operating system: | GNU/Linux Operating system version (Android/iOS) | N/A Browser: | Firefox AdGuard version: | N/A Filters enabled: | AdGuard Tracking Protection AdGuard mode (Android only): | N/A Filtering quality (Android only): | N/A HTTPS filtering (Android only): | N/A Simplified filters (iOS only) | N/A AdGuard DNS: | None Stealth mode options (Windows only) | N/A Helpdesk ID (if exists): | N/A [//]: # (This template is meant for missed ad/false positive reports, for other type of reports edit it accordingly)

comment.body: Can confirm this is still reproducible and still a very annoying issue; 88x31 buttons are a relic of the old web and highly popular on sites like neocities.org where people make personal websites and spread around 88x31 buttons of their sites. Found this issue myself specifically while working on my own site (oat.zone) where these buttons are visible under `ls badges`, but I can think of many more personal websites that use them for non-tracking or ad related purposes. (It's common practice to _avoid_ hotlinking buttons, if that's a concern.)

issue.title: qlogo.cn and baiducdnimages.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
